definition: to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
to alert/to warn/police
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device

sentences.english: Panicked, Laura dashed into the house, grabbed the phone and dialed the emergency number.
sentences.chinese: 勞娜驚慌地衝進屋裏，抓起電話，撥號報警。

sentences.english: See the two men to escape, Li master by telephone to the police report to the police.
sentences.chinese: 見兩名男子逃跑後，李師傅借電話向警方報警。

sentences.english: Each room is equipped with smoking detection system.
sentences.chinese: 酒店每間客房均設有煙感報警器。

sentences.english: Cy jordan silenced the warning horn .
sentences.chinese: 賽伊喬丹關掉了報警喇叭。

sentences.english: Then she ran to the pay-phone to call the polices.
sentences.chinese: 她立刻跑到投幣電話亭，打電話報警。

sentences.english: Stress management gives you a range of tools to reset your alarm system.
sentences.chinese: 控制好壓力能使你擁有一系列重置報警系統的工具。

sentences.english: Re-righting the walkie-talkie, you can cancel the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 把對講機重新扶正，即可取消報警。

sentences.english: The taping of the magnets was the final step.
sentences.chinese: 解決磁鐵報警器是最後一步。

sentences.english: Float-operated high and low level alarm system.
sentences.chinese: 氣動式滿倉與卸空報警系統。

sentences.english: The alarm printer and data logger are located in the central control room.
sentences.chinese: 報警打印和數據收集都佈置在中控室。

sentences.english: It is an important consist part of the FAS.
sentences.chinese: 它是火災自動報警系統的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Tangmou said that when she found that when the law on public security organs to the police.
sentences.chinese: 唐某稱，當她發現違法時，就向公安機關報警了。

sentences.english: Where is the emergency push-button for the alarm system?
sentences.chinese: 報警系統的應急按鈕在哪裏？

sentences.english: Alarms may be set for SpO2 and HR.
sentences.chinese: SpO2與心率均設置報警功能。

definition: to report a case to the authorities
to report (malefactors to the police)/to denounce
to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
to claim/to state/to proclaim/to assert
to phone/to telegram
office worker/staff member/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to defraud/to swindle/to blackmail

incoming telegram or telephone call/your telegram, telephone call, or message/to send a telegram or make a telephone call here (i.e. to the speaker)/to have instant attraction to sb/to have chemistry with sb/to come back (of electricity, after an outage)
to open fire/to shoot a gun
at the scene/on the spot
to get in touch with/to contact/to stay in contact (with)/liaison/(math.) connection
complaint/to complain/to register a complaint (esp. as a customer)
police officer/policeman
urgent/emergency
to follow/to follow up
